data.title: 5 Accessory Trends to Know From Bridal Fashion Week 2023
data.meta_description: No bridal ensemble is complete without accessories, and there are a few you should keep an eye out for in 2023! From opera gloves to capes, here are five of the accessory trends from Bridal Fashion Week 2023 to know.
data.text:
Opera Gloves

Brides are going to the opera this season! Traditional opera gloves popped up in multiple collections. Both Houghton and Scorcesa debuted classic arm-length gloves in ivory and black. While these simple gloves would complement a vintage bridal look, designers like Julie Vino brought a modern touch to the new trend with embellished fingerless gloves. Fingerless gloves with beaded embellishments are a great way to bring a modern elegance to your bridal look that is still fashion-forward.

Get the look with our Leila Gown, while it doesn’t include a pair of opera gloves, it does have beaded lace sleeves that will give you that same dramatic yet classic bridal look.

Colorful Veils

You’ll want to ditch your classic white veil after seeing this trend! Wedding veils got a colorful upgrade this season with Monique Lhuillier and Nadia Manjarrez debuting veils with colorful and floral embroidery. The splashes of color, while subtle, can complement any non-white embroidery on your wedding dress for a cohesive bridal look. Similar to choosing a white wedding veil, you’ll want to coordinate your veil color with the color of your wedding dress and potential dress embroidery to avoid any color clashes.

Get the look with our Beleafer of Love veil, while it’s not a colorful veil, it does include sparkling botanical embroidery for a modern take on this classic accessory.

Removable Sleeves

A good sleeve is the easiest way to add an extra bit of ‘oomph’ to your wedding dress, and this season it’s all about being able to remove them with the snap of a button or a slight pull. Nadia Manjarrez debuted dramatic removable sleeves with lace details and oversized bow silhouettes, while Claire Pettibone opted for lace puff sleeves for a more classic look. Whether you choose a simple or fully embellished sleeve, this trend is the perfect way to transform your bridal look without having to buy a second dress. You can take your wedding dress from classic to modern with just one addition or removal.

Get the look with our Jasmine Gown, which features detachable tulle sleeves for an elegantly modern wedding dress that easily converts from ceremony to reception.

Capes

We saw a lot of embroidered bridal capes in the Fall 2022 collections, but this season the trend is going back to its elegant and chic roots. Designers like Halfpenny London and Dana Harel debuted sleek detachable bridal capes with minimal embellishments. While the capes did include the occasional lace embroidery or floral appliques, this bridal accessory is meant to blend in with the wedding dress. Any embellishments used are meant to complement those on the wedding dress, making it the perfect accessory for a femininely elegant bridal style.

Get the look with our Moment of Ruth Cape, which is covered in sequin details for a shimmering addition to any wedding dress.

Statement Earrings

In seasons past, we’ve seen chandelier and drop earrings dominate collections respectively, but for Fall 2023 we’re seeing both being featured in collections. WONA Concept debuted mix-matched drop earrings with varying asymmetric lengths for a more modern look. Meanwhile, Jenny Yoo kept it classic with beaded chandelier earrings and pearl drop earrings. If you’re looking to add some sparkle to your bridal look or want an eye-catching accessory without all the fuss, consider statement earrings that include unexpected embellishments like asymmetric lengths or gradient pearls.

Get this bridal look with our Lady in White veil, while it’s not a pair of chandelier earrings, its simple tulle fabric can easily accommodate a bold jewelry choice.
